result.execSummary:
The defendant Reginald Edwards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No contact with: co-defendant's listed in the criminal complaint, no contact with the stores listed in the criminal complaint and read-in list.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school combination.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Provide DNA Sample if not yet already previously obtained. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Balance set at Zero.  Defendant paid $150.00 up front.

timeConds.notes: To be performed as a condition of probation.

Non-working hours with standard release conditions.  Defendant to report to the Huber Facility by 6:00 p.m. on November 16, 2016.  
*May be served in Milwaukee County but the Court DOES NOT authorize electronic monitoring.
